Package org.apache.tamaya

Class ConfigurationProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tamaya.ConfigurationProvider
  • @Deprecated
public final class ConfigurationProvider
extends Object
    Deprecated.
    Use static methods of Configuration
    Static access to the Configuration of the whole application.

        Deprecated.
        Access the current configuration.
        Returns:
        the corresponding Configuration instance, never null.

      • getConfiguration

        public static Configuration getConfiguration​(ClassLoader classLoader)
        Deprecated.
        Access the current configuration.
        Parameters:
        classLoader - the target classloader, not null.

        the corresponding Configuration instance, never null.

      • createConfiguration

        public static Configuration createConfiguration​(ConfigurationContext context)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new configuration instance based on the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - the configuration context, not null.
        Returns:
        a new Configuration instance, never null.

      • setConfiguration

        public static void setConfiguration​(Configuration config)
        Deprecated.
        This method allows replacement of the current default Configuration with a new instance. It is the responsibility of the ConfigurationProvider to trigger corresponding update events for the current Configuration, so observing listeners can do whatever is appropriate to react to any given configuration change.
        Parameters:
        config - the new Configuration to be applied, not null
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the current provider is read-only and does not support applying a new Configuration.

      • setConfiguration

        public static void setConfiguration​(Configuration config,
                                    ClassLoader classLoader)
        Deprecated.
        This method allows replacement of the current default Configuration with a new instance. It is the responsibility of the ConfigurationProvider to trigger corresponding update events for the current Configuration, so observing listeners can do whatever is appropriate to react to any given configuration change.
        Parameters:
        config - the new Configuration to be applied, not null
        classLoader - the target classloader, not null.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the current provider is read-only and does not support applying a new Configuration.

      • getConfigurationBuilder

        public static ConfigurationBuilder getConfigurationBuilder()
        Deprecated.
        Create a new ConfigurationBuilder instance. This method creates a new builder instance that is not related to any concrete Configuration. You can use Configuration.setCurrent(Configuration, ClassLoader) to change the current configuration.
        Returns:
        a new, empty ConfigurationBuilder, never null.
        See Also:
        Configuration.setCurrent(Configuration), Configuration.setCurrent(Configuration, ClassLoader), ConfigurationContext
